description: The Operational Support and Analysis (OSA) module is one of the certifications in the ITIL® Service Capability work stream. The module focuses on the practical application of OSA practices in order to enable event, incident, request, problem, access, technical, IT operations and application management. The OSA course can teach organizations and individuals how to manage the everyday operation of IT services and gain a better understanding of how to implement the ITIL processes that will enable them to deliver and support services to customers. It also covers issues relating to the people, relationships, procedures and infrastructure technology required to ensure that the organization or programs can provide the high quality and cost effective IT services that are required to meet organizational needs.
descriptionMD: ** Look for our partner PassionIT Group's information [HERE](https://itprotv-notes-bucket.s3.amazonaws.com/ITIL_OVERVIEW.zip)  Codes for offers are available to members and in the download in the second episode** The Operational Support and Analysis (OSA) module is one of the certifications in the ITIL® Service Capability work stream. The module focuses on the practical application of OSA practices in order to enable event, incident, request, problem, access, technical, IT operations and application management. The OSA course can teach organizations and individuals how to manage the everyday operation of IT services and gain a better understanding of how to implement the ITIL processes that will enable them to deliver and support services to customers. It also covers issues relating to the people, relationships, procedures and infrastructure technology required to ensure that the organization or programs can provide the high quality and cost effective IT services that are required to meet organizational needs. For course completion certificates to be submitted for exams, please [contact PassionIT Group](mailto:info@passionitgroup.com).
name: Accredited ITIL Intermediate - OSA
subtitle: Operational Support and Analysis

episodes.description: In this episode, Daniel and Terry give a general overview of what to expect in the upcoming ITIL OSA series. They cover topics like who is the intended audience, what the scope of the series will cover, and what are some specific topics that will be addressed. For course completion certificates to be submitted for exams, please contact PassionIT Group info@passionitgroup.com.
episodes.title: Overview

episodes.description: In this episode, Daniel and Terry discuss the foundational information that you as an exam taker need to know about the ITIL Operational Support and Analysis(OSA) exam. They take a brief look at the exam topics as well as details about taking the exam and what is required to pass. They also explore the ITIL exam structure and credit scheme.
episodes.title: Logistics, Expectations and Startup

episodes.description: In this episode, Daniel and Terry take the time to review the ITIL Foundations exam concepts specifically found in the Service Lifecycle domain. This is done to reinforce knowledge that the OSA exam will assume in their questioning.
episodes.title: Reviewing the Service Lifecycle

episodes.description: In this episode, Daniel and Terry explore Incident Management topics covered in the ITIL OSA exam. They start by defining both Incident Management and Incidents proper. They look at being proactive and reactive as well as setting prioritization for incidents. Finally, they cover investigation, diagnosis, and resolution.
episodes.title: Incident Management

episodes.description: In this episode, Daniel and Terry dive into Problem Management. They begin by defining Problem Management, its purpose, policies, principles, and basic concepts. Then they look at problem analysis techniques like pareto analysis and pain value. Finally they cover Problem Management approaches, detection, logging, and resolution.
episodes.title: Problem Management

episodes.description: In this episode, Daniel and Terry take a look at Event Management as covered in the ITIL OSA exam. They start by defining what Events are, how they differ from Incidents, what's their value, and their categories. Then they describe the process of designing Event Management as well as detecting/filtering/notification, event correlation, triggers, and response.
episodes.title: Event Management

episodes.description: In this episode, Daniel and Terry move into the area of Request Fulfillment. They begin by defining Request Fulfillment as well as its policies, principles, and concepts. Then they discuss Standardization, Request Logging, Categorization, Prioritization, Authorization, Fulfillment, and Closure.
episodes.title: Request Fulfillment

episodes.description: In this episode, Daniel and Terry discuss the Service Operation stage for the ITIL OSA exam. They present a general overview of the Service Operations stage which includes its purpose, value to the organization, and possible value it brings.
episodes.title: Service Operation Stage

episodes.description: In this episode, Daniel and Terry go over what you need to know about Access Management for the ITIL OSA exam. They discuss exactly what is Access Management. Then they get into "Why Access Management", basic concepts like Access, Identity, Rights, Services, and Directory Services. Finally they explain Access Management sources, verification of requests, and monitoring status.
episodes.title: Access Management

episodes.description: In this episode, Daniel and Terry take a look at the Service Desk Function. They start by comparing the difference between Functions and Processes. Next, they define the Service Desk's job, objectives, and staffing considerations. Finally they explore performance measuring.
episodes.title: The Service Desk Function

episodes.description: In this episode, Daniel and Terry go over the "Other 3 Functions" which are Technical Management, Application Management, and IT Operations Management. They spend time examining the roles and functions of each.
episodes.title: The Other Three Functions

episodes.description: In this episode, Daniel and Terry describe some of the technologies and their implementations used by Operational Support teams. This includes self-help tools like FAQs, Automated Request forms, and Reporting tools. Then they discuss which tools are used by which areas and tool requirements. Finally to take a look at methodology and best practices.
episodes.title: Technology and Implementation

episodes.description: Terry and Zach go over four sample questions from the 'ITIL Intermediate Exams' ITIL Operational Support and Analysis section, with the end goal being how to determine your best answer for each. In this episode, Terry and Zach cover the first four questions.
episodes.title: Sample Paper Review

episodes.description: Terry and Zach go over 4 sample questions from the 'ITIL Intermediate Exams' ITIL Operational Support and Analysis section, with the end goal being how to determine your best answer for each. In this episode, Terry & Zach cover questions 5 through 8, and offer a direction to PassionITGroup.Com & Deckerheads@yahoo.com.
episodes.title: Sample Paper Review Part 2
